summary: Big Move Convexity: autonomous 0DTE options trading pipeline with real-time Polygon WebSocket data, 351-feature ML signal, and dashboard monitoring.

features.title: Big Move Convexity Strategy
features.summary: Autonomous 0DTE options entry strategy powered by a 351-feature LightGBM ensemble signal evaluated every 60 seconds.
features.description:
A new ExecutionStrategy that runs inside the IB agent's 100ms eval loop. Every 60 seconds during the scan window (13:30-15:55 ET), it assembles a 351-feature vector from real-time bars, computes a volatility prediction via the trained LightGBM model, and generates entry signals for 20bp OTM 0DTE SPY options.

Key parameters are hot-reloadable via the dashboard: signal threshold, cooldown, direction mode, max contracts, contract budget, scan window, and auto-entry toggle. Auto-entry defaults to OFF for safety.

On fill, the strategy spawns a RiskManagerStrategy with the new 'zero_dte_convexity' preset: no stop loss (hold losers to expiry), trailing stop at 25% below peak (activates at +50%), and tiered profit-taking at 2x/4x/6x/11x.

features.title: 351-Feature Signal Architecture
features.summary: The signal draws from 6 feature groups spanning microstructure, intraday path, cross-asset, macro, options-implied, and day signature.
features.description:
The Big Move Convexity signal assembles 351 features across 6 groups, computed at multiple bar resolutions (5s, 15s, 1m):

**Group A: Equity Microstructure (270 features)**
Realtime market microstructure at 5 lookback windows (30s, 2m, 10m, 60m, open-to-t) x 3 bar resolutions. Includes: Garman-Klass realized volatility, vol-of-vol, bid-ask spread mean/vol, quote/trade intensity, volume rate & acceleration, trade imbalance (signed order flow), quote imbalance, Amihud illiquidity, VWAP displacement, and a parametric EMA displacement grid (spans 5/10/20/50/100/200).

**Group B: Intraday Path (12 features)**
Session-level price trajectory: premarket return, overnight gap, opening range (size + position within range), midday drift, post-13:30 drift, session return/vol, distance from session high/low, trend-vs-chop (R-squared), reversal count.

**Group C: Cross-Asset Displacement (17 features)**
SPY vs QQQ divergence (return spread, vol ratio, rolling correlation, correlation breakdown, lead-lag). Plus cross-asset displacement vs IWM, TLT, GLD, HYG (return spread, vol ratio, rolling correlation each). The HYG return spread and TLT return spread were the top-ranked features in Phase 2 research -- they capture slow cross-asset information propagation into SPY option pricing.

**Group D: Macro Context (9 features)**
Prior-session regime state: KRJ macro regime ID + probability, regime age, VIX level + 1d change, displacement composite, VIX term structure slope (VIX/VIX3M), VIX 20-day percentile, realized-vs-implied variance risk premium.

**Group E: Options-Implied (7 features)**
Live options chain signals: ATM implied volatility, 25-delta skew, 0DTE/1DTE term structure slope, put-call volume ratio, dealer gamma exposure proxy, realized-vs-implied intraday, straddle richness.

**Group F: Day Signature (36 features)**
12-bin intraday path shape encoding: cumulative return, normalized volume fraction, and realized volatility per bin. Also provides a (T, 3) tensor for sequence model input (LSTM/TCN/Transformer).

features.title: Real-Time Polygon WebSocket + Bar Construction
features.summary: Live tick data from Polygon WebSocket feeds real-time 5s/15s/1m OHLCV bars for feature computation.
features.description:
Two new modules in the research repo: PolygonWSClient handles WebSocket connection management (auth, subscribe, reconnect with exponential backoff) on top of the existing PolygonWebSocketProvider message parser. BarAccumulator converts individual trade and quote ticks into multi-resolution OHLCV bars (5s, 15s, 1m) with thread-safe accumulation.

The strategy runs the Polygon WS in a background thread, feeding ticks to BarAccumulator which emits completed bars to LiveDataStore. Defaults to real-time data via the paid Polygon tier (configurable to delayed for testing).

features.title: Signals Dashboard Tab
features.summary: New 'Signals' tab on the Options page shows real-time BMC signal state, positions, and configurable parameters.
features.description:
A new fourth tab on the M&A Options page provides full transparency into the autonomous trading pipeline:

- Status bar: Polygon WS connection state, bars accumulated, last decision time
- Signal panel: Current probability, direction, strength (color-coded green/red/gray)
- Position monitor: Active BMC positions with entry price, current P&L, risk manager state
- Config panel: Editable threshold, cooldown, auto-entry toggle, scan window, max contracts
- Override buttons: Pause/Resume scanning, Force Close All, Manual Entry
- Signal history: Last 20 signals with timestamps and outcomes

Polls the agent every 2 seconds (skips when tab is backgrounded).

features.title: Zero-DTE Convexity Risk Preset
features.summary: New risk management preset optimized for 0DTE options: hold losers, trail winners at 25%.
features.description:
Research found that 79% of winning 0DTE trades retrace at least 50% from peak, and trailing at 25% adds +243pp to profit factor vs hold-to-expiry. The new 'zero_dte_convexity' preset implements this:

- No stop loss (fees eat remaining value on losers)
- Trailing stop: activates at +50%, trails at 25% below peak
- Profit targets: bank 15% at 2x, 20% at 4x, 25% at 6x, 50% at 11x
- Market orders for speed on 0DTE exits
